elements.title: Pavonia praemorsa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the flowers of Pavonia praemorsa (pictured) bloom and die within the same day?

elements.title: Joan Ruth (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that soprano Joan Ruth rejected a marriage proposal because her suitor wanted her to abandon ambitions of a singing career?

elements.title: the mascots (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the mascots of the 2026 Winter Olympics and 2026 Winter Paralympics were designed by schoolchildren?

elements.title: Bengisu Avcı (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bengisu Avcı had to abandon her 45-kilometre (28-mile) swim across the Kaiwi Channel after being stung by jellyfish twelve hours in?

elements.title: Libotonius (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some of the first likely Libotonius fossils collected are lost at the Smithsonian?

elements.title: Barry Melbourne Hussey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Argentine naval officer Barry Melbourne Hussey was known as El Ingles ('The Englishman') by his comrades?

elements.title: Tobey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2024 song "Tobey" features "3 generations of Detroit"?

elements.title: Leonhard Kaiser (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Leonhard Kaiser, a student of Martin Luther, was burned at the stake on 16 August 1527 after being declared guilty of heresy?

elements.title: Cultybraggan Camp (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the area of Cultybraggan Camp has been a royal hunting ground, a prison for fervent Nazis and the site of an underground bunker intended for use in a nuclear war?
